data.title: Obituary: Steven Roy Cupp
data.meta_description: Obituary: Steven Roy Cupp - The Cullman Tribune - Obituaries
data.text:
Steven Roy Cupp, 74, of Cullman was preceded in death by parents Earnest Roy Cupp, Jr. and Alesia Chandler Cupp. Sister Karen Cupp Klugh (Ben). Survived in death by his wife, Barbara Marlar Cupp. Children Bryan Cupp, Brandy Cupp (Brandon Gamble), Trey Doyle (Heather), Lindsey James (Nathan). 4 Grandsons and 5 Granddaughters. Sisters Linda Cupp Dodson (Daniel), Pamela Cupp McWilliams, Cecille Cupp Cooper (Bobby), Brothers Michael Cupp (Susan), Jeffrey Cupp (Melanie). A host of nieces and nephews.

Steve served in the Army National Guard. He was a custom home builder on Smith Lake for over 50 years. People called him “The Legend.” He loved his wife, Barbara, and his family. He was a true craftsman and it was evident in the homes he built. He sawmilled his own wood of different varieties. This allowed him to make one-of-a-kind pieces, including tables, mantles, beams, columns, etc. He even made balusters out of crepe myrtle limbs for some customers. Whatever the customers wanted, he could build it!

A visitation for Steve will be held Friday, July 26, 2024 from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Good Hope Baptist Church, 90 Good Hope School Road, Cullman, AL 35057, followed by a Celebration of Life Funeral Service at 1 p.m.

Steve will be laid to rest in Good Hope Cemetery, 90 Good Hope School Road, Good Hope, AL 35057.

In lieu of flowers, donations may be made online or mailed to UAB Center for Palliative and Comfort Care.
